text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>Bey Herrn Daniel Haag dem Buchbinder sind zu verkauffen: <BIBL><TITLE>Steiners Fest-Gedancken</TITLE> in <FORMAT>Fol.</FORMAT> <PRICE>2. fl. 24. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Neues und vollkommenes Gebettbuch</TITLE> in <FORMAT>gr. 8vo.</FORMAT> von <AUTHOR>Pfarrer Stehelin</AUTHOR> in <PLACE>St. Gallen</PLACE>, ohngebunden <PRICE>46. kr.</PRICE>; gebunden in Leder und Schlotz <PRICE>fl. 1. 10. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Memoires de Rochester</TITLE>, <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> ohngebunden <PRICE>6. Batzen</PRICE>;</BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Maupertuis</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Anfang der Geographie</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <PRICE>6. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Messung des Meridians Gradus</TITLE>, <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <PRICE>12. Batzen</PRICE>;</BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Satura pars II.</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <PRICE>18. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Gespräch von den Würmen welche bey Anfang dieses Jahrs auf dem Schnee gefunden worden</TITLE> <PRICE>8. Rappen</PRICE>, und viele andere mehr, davon der Bericht bey Ihme zu vernemmen.</BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":9,"explanation":"1) Unified the price tag name: replaced all occurrences of <PRIZE>…</PRIZE> with <PRICE>…</PRICE> for consistency.
2) Corrected one inconsistent tag pair <PRICE>12. Batzen;</PRICE> by removing the semicolon from inside the tag content and placing it after the closing tag.
3) Closed the BIBL element for “Memoires de Rochester”: the original nested the following BIBL directly without closing; now </BIBL> is inserted right after the first PRICE.
4) Added a missing closing </BIBL> for the “Maupertuis / Anfang der Geographie” entry so each bibliographic item is in its own BIBL wrapper.
5) Standardized the format strings corrupted by encoding (e.g. “gro√ü 8v√≤.”, “8v√≤.”) to “gr. 8vo.” and “8vo.”, a conventional way to represent the octavo format.
6) Corrected “Anf√§ng” (corrupt encoding) to “Anfang” in the TITLE of Maupertuis’ work.
7) Corrected “Gespr√§ch” to “Gespräch” and “W√ºrmen” to “Würmen” where encoding was broken.
8) Removed stray encoding artefacts “†” and similar from the text and price contexts, keeping only meaningful characters.
9) Removed trailing punctuation from inside several <PRICE> elements (e.g. semicolons and commas) and placed it immediately after the closing </PRICE> when it functioned as sentence or list punctuation, so the numeric price data inside the tag is clean while the surrounding text remains faithful to the original punctuation."}

Batzen</PRICE>;</BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Maupertuis</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Anfang der Geographie</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <PRICE>6. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Messung des Meridians Gradus</TITLE>, <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <PRICE>12. Batzen</PRICE>;</BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Satura pars II.</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <PRICE>18. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Gespräch von den Würmen welche bey Anfang dieses Jahrs auf dem Schnee gefunden worden</TITLE> <PRICE>8. Rappen</PRICE>, und viele andere mehr, davon der Bericht bey Ihme zu vernemmen.</BIBL></ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Unified the price tag name: replaced all occurrences of <PRIZE>…</PRIZE> with <PRICE>…</PRICE> for consistency.
2) Corrected one inconsistent tag pair <PRICE>12. Batzen;</PRICE> by removing the semicolon from inside the tag content and placing it after the closing tag.
3) Closed the BIBL element for “Memoires de Rochester”: the original nested the following BIBL directly without closing; now </BIBL> is inserted right after the first PRICE.
4) Added a missing closing </BIBL> for the “Maupertuis / Anfang der Geographie” entry so each bibliographic item is in its own BIBL wrapper.
5) Standardized the format strings corrupted by encoding (e.g. “gro√ü 8v√≤.”, “8v√≤.”) to “gr. 8vo.” and “8vo.”, a conventional way to represent the octavo format.
6) Corrected “Anf√§ng” (corrupt encoding) to “Anfang” in the TITLE of Maupertuis’ work.
7) Corrected “Gespr√§ch” to “Gespräch” and “W√ºrmen” to “Würmen” where encoding was broken.
8) Removed stray encoding artefacts “†” and similar from the text and price contexts, keeping only meaningful characters.
9) Removed trailing punctuation from inside several <PRICE> elements (e.g. semicolons and commas) and placed it immediately after the closing </PRICE> when it functioned as sentence or list punctuation, so the numeric price data inside the tag is clean while the surrounding text remains faithful to the original punctuation.
